Software Engineering student, programming enthusiast, and a cinephile. Currently looking for an internship opportunity in Software Engineering or related fields.
What are your main interests in tech?

I'm especially interested in software development, mainly back-end development. I enjoy building systems that work behind the scenes to power applications. However, I'm also open to full-stack development, as I appreciate the value of understanding both front-end and back-end.
Why do you prefer back-end development?

I enjoy the logical and structured nature of back-end development. Working with APIs, databases, and system architecture feels natural to me. It’s also where I get to solve complex problems, which is something I find very satisfying.
Have you worked on any projects?

Yes, I’ve worked on various web-based projects, including a magazine website and a cloud storage full stack web application. These experiences have helped me apply my knowledge in real-world scenarios.
Are you learning anything new right now?
Yes! I'm currently exploring machine learning and how to integrate it into applications. I'm also looking into how to convert models from Python into mobile-friendly formats like Kotlin or Flutter.
Do you work better alone or in a team?

I can work independently, but I really enjoy being part of a team. I’ve worked in group projects where I implemented designs into code, even when the design came from team members without web experience.
What’s something you're working to improve?

I'm working on improving my design sense so I can collaborate more smoothly with designers. I'm also improving my English and communication skills to become a better team member in international environments.
I aim to become a skilled software developer, possibly specializing in back-end or full-stack development. I’m also interested in roles where I can work closely with data and machine learning.
